content: Allow users to find local skate communities.
Allow skaters to upload details about skate areas, like photos, type of location, and terrain.
Show local activities or events.
Allow users to add events and view local skate activities.
Add a forum where users can ask questions, discuss, and share knowledge about skating, tricks, spots, equipment, etc.
Add a “Find a Skate Buddy” option with skill levels (beginner, intermediate, expert).
Improve ways to find local skaters and communicate via direct message.
Provide a “Find a Skate Park/Spot” feature to locate nearby skate spots.
Enable route ratings and notes to flag poor surfaces or challenging areas.
Change the home feed to show posts from people closest to you and move community posts to a Discover page.
Create a skate buddy finder and allow tagging friends in sessions.
Add a skate events section where users can list events.
Add a section for skate-related events near users, like roller dance parties or competitions.
Enable users to create and join groups, such as city groups or derby teams.
Incorporate event calendars for local skate events, like roller derbies and group rollouts.
Allow group gathering planning with notifications for nearby skaters.
Allow feedback on specific route sections, like surface quality or hazards.
Add a review system for skate spots, allowing photos and notes.
When learning is ready, allow users to add tricks and challenges to a personal bucket list.
Add session details later if users forget to start tracking initially.
Allow filtering by country and region to find local skaters.
Add a library of tutorials and tips for learning new moves.
Add group creation for local skaters with shared interests, like skate moms with strollers.
Enable tracking and audio to run in the background while the app is minimized to save battery life.
Create a progress tracker for skills and tricks with a confidence log for each session.
Enable users to click on skate routes and see photos and descriptions.
Allow users to resume sessions if they accidentally hit “stop.”
Include tags to describe terrain, safety, and conditions in posts.
Allow users to submit their favorite skate spots with descriptions.
Create a place to log terrain notes with information on gravel, steep hills, traffic, and other hazards.
Add editing capabilities for skate session details, including start/stop times.
Introduce a “Rate the Skate” feature with questions like level, terrain, and steepness.
Allow location to be added manually to avoid keeping tracking on for extended periods, such as at a skate park.
Enable offline tracking to allow sessions even in areas with low signal.
Add a feature to trim GPS data to avoid sharing sensitive locations.
Enable “Skate Together” mode to connect multiple profiles during group sessions.
Show a calendar with a history of skating activities, showing monthly totals.
Provide a way to manage submissions like skate spots and update photos or details.
Link with Google searches to show skating rinks, parks, and trails.
Integrate tracking with mobile health apps, like Apple Health, to sync data from wearables.
Add a community calendar for events like roller discos.
Allow users to plan sessions with local skaters based on style—like jam skaters with jam skaters or ramp skaters with ramp skaters.
Add a privacy feature to obscure the start of sessions from the user’s home.
Show real-time distance skated during a session without finalizing it.
Allow users to add sessions after the fact if they forgot to turn the app on.
Display recent skaters in an area (e.g., last 10–20 days) for potential meetups.
Include a filter or search by skating style to help users find compatible skate buddies.
Enable filtering in the feed by skate style, location, and more.
Allow users to join and promote local skating crews.
Provide recommendations for popular skating spots.
Enable adding sessions manually without GPS data if recording was missed.
Provide options to remove the last few meters of a tracked route to obscure home location.
Mark skate spots by difficulty level (e.g., red for difficult, green for all levels).
Provide an option to manually add session location and duration for privacy or other reasons.
Include a checklist of roller skate and inline tricks that users can track as they learn.
Enable tagging friends in sessions.
Enable chatting with friends in the app.
Provide real-time tracking so users can see distance skated without finalizing the session.
Display city/country on public profiles to help users find local skaters.
Include an annual calendar of skate events and festivals worldwide.
Add icons for skate styles (derby, freestyle, street, etc.) next to profile pictures.
Display skater location (country, area) to help people connect.
Provide short “how-to” video clips for trick practice.
Enable users to create events and allow RSVP registration.
Allow editing of skated times if the app was turned on halfway through a session.
Provide an option to delete a route if it was started by accident.
Add visual goals and tracking for tricks. Users could list tricks they want to learn and check them off when completed.
Add a feature for skaters to log skate locations with address, notes, and more.
Add filters for skate spots based on terrain, hills, or ramps.
Include stats showing total distance skated in a session.
Add calories burned, fastest speed, and options to adjust stop time for more accurate stats.
Track trails and allow filtering by less crowded places.
Add skate park locations.
Allow editing of session workout times.
Allow users to add different skate types in their profile and select skates for each session.
Include stats like average speed, max speed, and calorie count in the tracking feature.
Add a distance selector in the “Local” tab to define the user’s local area.
Add a place on the profile to list skate models, allowing performance comparisons.
Offer information about different skate styles (artistic, slalom, derby, etc.) to inspire users.
Add dark mode.
Include an “Alert me when I leave” option for stationary activities, so users don’t accidentally leave tracking on and disrupt session data.
Include lock screen notifications when a session is in progress as a reminder.
